p: The manganese phosphating coating was prepared according to the procedure described in Table 2. To determine the effect of nickel and manganese on the quality of a phosphate coating two low-alloy steel samples of the same size were prepared (2 cm × 2 cm). The amount of nickel in the phosphating bath varied from 0 to 1 g Ni(NO 3) 2∙6 H 2O per 1 dm 3, which is the equivalent of 0.0 to 0.12 g Ni per 1 dm 3 of phosphating solution. The samples differed only in the weight of the added nickel (II) nitrate (V) added to phosphating bath.
